intro: Polygala zablotskiana, commonly known as the Zablotskian milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually pale green or yellowish, and it produces small, bean-like pods containing seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
